projects.title: Internal Developer Platform on Kubernetes
projects.description: Build a production-grade Internal Developer Platform using Backstage, Crossplane, and ArgoCD for self-service infrastructure
projects.shortDescription: Complete IDP with self-service infrastructure provisioning
projects.fullDescription: Design and implement an enterprise-grade Internal Developer Platform that enables developers to self-service provision infrastructure, deploy applications, and manage their entire lifecycle through a unified portal. This project demonstrates platform engineering expertise, GitOps workflows, and modern DevOps practices that are highly sought after at top companies.

implementationSteps.title: Set Up Kubernetes Cluster & Core Components
implementationSteps.description: Create a production-like Kubernetes cluster (EKS/GKE/AKS or local with kind). Install core components: ArgoCD for GitOps, Prometheus/Grafana for observability, cert-manager for TLS, and ingress controller. Set up namespaces for platform components and tenant applications. Document the cluster architecture and component interactions.

implementationSteps.title: Deploy Backstage Developer Portal
implementationSteps.description: Install and configure Backstage as the central developer portal. Create a PostgreSQL database for Backstage metadata. Configure authentication (OAuth/SAML) and RBAC. Build service catalog with templates for common services (APIs, databases, frontends). Integrate with GitHub/GitLab for repository management and CI/CD visualization.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Infrastructure Provisioning with Crossplane
implementationSteps.description: Install Crossplane and configure cloud providers (AWS/Azure/GCP). Create Composite Resource Definitions (XRDs) for common infrastructure: databases, message queues, storage buckets, VPCs. Build self-service workflows where developers request infrastructure through Backstage, which triggers Crossplane to provision resources. Implement resource lifecycle management and cost tracking.

implementationSteps.title: Set Up GitOps Workflows with ArgoCD
implementationSteps.description: Configure ArgoCD for multi-tenant deployments with ApplicationSets. Create Helm charts and Kustomize overlays for application templates. Implement promotion workflows: dev → staging → production. Set up automated sync policies, health checks, and rollback mechanisms. Create dashboards showing deployment status across environments.

implementationSteps.title: Add Observability & Self-Service Monitoring
implementationSteps.description: Integrate Prometheus for metrics collection and Grafana for visualization. Create default dashboards for common metrics (CPU, memory, requests, errors). Set up OpenTelemetry for distributed tracing. Build self-service alerting where developers can configure alerts through Backstage templates. Implement log aggregation with Loki or ELK stack.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Security & Compliance
implementationSteps.description: Add policy enforcement with OPA Gatekeeper or Kyverno for security policies. Integrate container scanning with Trivy in CI/CD pipelines. Implement secrets management with Vault and External Secrets Operator. Create RBAC policies for multi-tenancy. Add audit logging and compliance reporting. Document security best practices and provide developer guidelines.

projects.title: Enterprise DevSecOps CI/CD Pipeline
projects.description: Build a comprehensive DevSecOps pipeline with automated security scanning, compliance checks, and zero-trust deployment
projects.shortDescription: Complete DevSecOps pipeline with security automation
projects.fullDescription: Design and implement an enterprise-grade CI/CD pipeline that integrates security at every stage, from code commit to production deployment. This project showcases your ability to build secure, compliant, and automated delivery pipelines that meet the standards of highly-regulated industries like finance and healthcare.

implementationSteps.title: Design Pipeline Architecture
implementationSteps.description: Design a multi-stage CI/CD pipeline with security gates at each stage: Code Analysis → Build → Security Scan → Test → Deploy. Choose CI/CD platform (GitLab CI, GitHub Actions, or Jenkins). Document security requirements: SAST, DAST, container scanning, secrets detection, license compliance. Define quality gates and approval workflows for production deployments.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Code Quality & SAST
implementationSteps.description: Integrate static code analysis tools: SonarQube for code quality, Semgrep for security patterns, and ESLint/Pylint for linting. Configure SAST tools to detect common vulnerabilities (SQL injection, XSS, hardcoded secrets). Set up quality gates that fail builds if critical issues are found. Create reports and dashboards for code quality metrics over time.

implementationSteps.title: Add Container & Dependency Scanning
implementationSteps.description: Integrate Trivy or Snyk for container image scanning to detect CVEs in base images and dependencies. Scan application dependencies for known vulnerabilities. Implement license compliance checks to ensure only approved licenses are used. Create automated remediation workflows: update dependencies, rebuild images, and notify developers of issues.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Secrets Management
implementationSteps.description: Set up HashiCorp Vault for centralized secrets management. Integrate Vault with CI/CD pipelines to inject secrets at runtime (no secrets in code or config files). Use dynamic secrets for databases and cloud resources. Implement secrets rotation policies. Add pre-commit hooks to detect accidental secret commits using tools like git-secrets or TruffleHog.

implementationSteps.title: Add Policy as Code & Compliance
implementationSteps.description: Implement Open Policy Agent (OPA) for policy enforcement: container image policies (only from approved registries), resource limits, security contexts, network policies. Create compliance checks for industry standards (CIS benchmarks, PCI-DSS, HIPAA). Generate compliance reports for audits. Implement admission control in Kubernetes to enforce policies at deployment time.

implementationSteps.title: Deploy with Zero-Trust & Monitoring
implementationSteps.description: Implement zero-trust deployment: mutual TLS with service mesh (Istio/Linkerd), identity-based access control, and network policies. Add DAST (Dynamic Application Security Testing) in staging environment using OWASP ZAP. Integrate with monitoring and alerting: failed security scans, policy violations, unusual deployment patterns. Create incident response runbooks and post-deployment verification tests.

projects.title: Multi-Cloud Disaster Recovery & FinOps System
projects.description: Design and implement a multi-cloud disaster recovery system with automated failover, cost optimization, and FinOps dashboards
projects.shortDescription: Complete multi-cloud DR with cost optimization
projects.fullDescription: Build an enterprise-grade multi-cloud disaster recovery solution that spans AWS and Azure (or GCP), with automated failover, data replication, and comprehensive cost optimization. This project demonstrates your ability to architect resilient systems at scale while managing cloud costs effectively - critical skills for senior DevOps/SRE roles.

implementationSteps.title: Design Multi-Cloud Architecture
implementationSteps.description: Design active-passive or active-active multi-cloud architecture spanning AWS and Azure. Document RTO (Recovery Time Objective) and RPO (Recovery Point Objective) requirements. Design data replication strategy: database replication, object storage sync, and state management. Plan DNS-based failover using Route53 and Azure Traffic Manager. Create architecture diagrams and document failure scenarios.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Infrastructure as Code
implementationSteps.description: Create Terraform modules for multi-cloud infrastructure: compute, networking, storage, databases. Use Terraform workspaces or separate state files for each cloud provider. Implement reusable modules for common patterns. Set up Terraform Cloud or self-hosted backend for state management. Create CI/CD pipeline for infrastructure changes with plan/apply approval workflows.

implementationSteps.title: Set Up Data Replication & Backup
implementationSteps.description: Implement database replication: AWS RDS to Azure Database (or Cloud SQL) using native replication or third-party tools. Set up object storage replication between S3 and Azure Blob Storage using tools like rclone or cloud-native replication. Implement automated backup strategies with retention policies. Create backup verification and restore testing automation. Document RPO achievement for each data tier.

implementationSteps.title: Build Automated Failover System
implementationSteps.description: Create health check monitoring across both clouds using Prometheus, Datadog, or CloudWatch + Azure Monitor. Build automated failover orchestration: detect outage, promote standby to primary, update DNS, notify teams. Implement runbooks as code using Ansible or Python scripts. Create failover testing procedure (chaos engineering) to validate the system regularly. Set up alerting and paging for failover events.

implementationSteps.title: Implement FinOps & Cost Optimization
implementationSteps.description: Deploy cost monitoring tools: Kubecost for Kubernetes, Cloud Custodian for policy-based optimization, or OpenCost. Create cost allocation tags and labels across all resources. Build FinOps dashboard in Grafana showing: cost per service, cost trends, optimization opportunities, and budget alerts. Implement automated cost optimization: rightsizing recommendations, unused resource cleanup, spot instance usage, and reserved instance management.

implementationSteps.title: Testing, Documentation & Runbooks
implementationSteps.description: Conduct disaster recovery drills: simulate primary region failure and measure actual RTO/RPO. Document recovery procedures and create runbooks for different failure scenarios. Build observability dashboards showing replication lag, failover health, and cross-cloud latency. Create capacity planning reports and cost forecasts. Implement SLOs for system availability and create error budgets. Present architecture and results to stakeholders with ROI analysis.
